entry.title: Ethereum Name Service Regains Control of EthLink Domain in Lawsuit Against GoDaddy
entry.summary: Eth.link was “sniped” earlier this month after an expiration date snafu led to a $850,000 auction.

entry.title: Treasury Asks for Public Input to Shape Crypto Regulations—Including NFTs and DeFi
entry.summary: The Treasury's questionnaire is designed to assess how the government can better address crime associated with crypto.

entry.title: SEC Charges Crypto Influencer Ian Balina Over Unregistered ICO in 2018
entry.summary: The SEC alleges that Ian Balina violated securities regulations when conducting Sparkster’s $30,000 ICO in 2018.

entry.title: WazirX Delists USDC Stablecoin, Converting User Holdings to Binance USD
entry.summary: India’s largest crypto exchange WazirX has followed Binance in delisting three stablecoins and "auto-converting" user balances to BUSD.

entry.title: PGA Tour Golf NFTs Coming to Tom Brady’s Autograph Platform
entry.summary: Autograph will tap into the golf league’s video and data archives to create NFT collectibles, with the help of Tiger Woods.

entry.title: UK Financial Regulator Issues Consumer Warning Against FTX
entry.summary: The Financial Conduct Authority has warned that crypto exchange FTX is not authorized to provide financial services or products in the UK.

entry.title: South Korean Authorities Request Interpol Red Notice For Terra’s Do Kwon
entry.summary: With the Terra co-founder's current location a mystery, South Korean prosecutors have requested that Interpol issue a red notice.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried: FTX Has $1 Billion to Spend on Acquisitions
entry.summary: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried revealed that the exchange has a ‘ballpark billion’ to spend on companies and projects.

entry.title: Ethereum Fork ETHPoW Suffers Bridge Replay Exploit, Token Tanks 37%
entry.summary: The replay exploit took place on a third-party contract, enabling the attacker to make away with 200 ETHW tokens.

entry.title: Over $433M in Liquidations as Bitcoin, Ethereum Plunge
entry.summary: The Fed’s upcoming rate hike alongside Bitcoin’s all-time high network difficulty pushed the top cryptos down at least 8% over the past 24 hours.

entry.title: Ethereum, Bitcoin Slide Further Through The Weekend
entry.summary: All eyes are on the next Fed meeting on Sept. 21, where another interest rate hike is expected.

entry.title: Ethereum Merge Hard Forks Reveal Competing Proof-of-Work Projects
entry.summary: Before EthereumPoW begat ETHW, EthereumFair pitched ETHF—now ETF.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Ethereum Merges, Hoskinson Gets Salty, Concerns Over Centralized Staking
entry.summary: Terra CEO Do Kwon breaks his silence and said he’s not running from South Korean authorities.

entry.title: Terra Co-Founder Do Kwon: I Am Not 'On the Run'
entry.summary: The man behind Terra is wanted by South Korean authorities and is not in Singapore as they thought, but tweeted that he's not hiding.

entry.title: What Are Meebits? Metaverse-Ready NFTs From the Creator of CryptoPunks
entry.summary: From the studio behind CryptoPunks, Meebits are a series of 20,000 3D voxel NFT characters with randomized traits.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum Posts Biggest Losses on Merge Week
entry.summary: The Ethereum network smoothly transitioned to proof-of-stake, but its native cryptocurrency depreciated more than most leading coins.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Hires Chief Gaming Officer to Further Web3 Gaming Push
entry.summary: Mobile gaming exec Spencer Tucker will oversee Yuga Labs’ Otherside.

entry.title: Ethereum Infrastructure Developer Infura Is Decentralizing, Protocol to Launch Next Year
entry.summary: Infura's "Decentralized Infrastructure Network" will seek to do away with outages on Ethereum due to a "single point of failure."

entry.title: Dogecoin Now Second-Largest Proof-of-Work Coin After Ethereum Merge
entry.summary: With Ethereum’s switch to proof-of-stake, Dogecoin is now second only to Bitcoin among minable, proof-of-work coins.

entry.title: Ethereum Continues to Sink Post-Merge: Down 18.5% in 3 Days
entry.summary: ETH took a beating this week despite the success of Ethereum’s merge to proof of stake.

entry.title: ApeCoin Treasury Set to Unlock 25 Million APE Tokens for Launch Contributors
entry.summary: APE is down about 9% today ahead of a significant token unlock for launch contributors—but staking is also on the horizon.

entry.title: Grayscale Says It May Sell ETHW Stash, Distribute Value to Ethereum Fund Investors
entry.summary: The asset manager today filed a “distribution of rights” declaration with the SEC regarding its holdings of the forked Ethereum coins.

entry.title: Bankrupt Crypto Lender Celsius Wants to Sell its $23M Stablecoin Holdings
entry.summary: The sale of Celsius' stablecoin holdings will pay for the crypto lender’s daily operations, but won’t be used to pay back creditors.

entry.title: White House Releases ‘Comprehensive Framework’ for Crypto Regulation and Development
entry.summary: The White House’s recommendations are built on six months of wide-ranging research across the digital asset sector.

entry.title: El Salvador’s Bitcoin-Loving President Bukele to Run for Re-Election
entry.summary: Nayib Bukele announces that he will seek reelection, while ratings agency Fitch downgrades El Salvador’s debt rating to CC.

entry.title: Ethereum Liquidations Top $127M Amid Post-Merge Volatility
entry.summary: Despite the success of the merge, ETH slumped following SEC Chair Gary Gensler’s suggestion that proof-of-stake cryptos could be considered securities.

entry.title: Big Firms Dominate Post-Merge Ethereum Validation
entry.summary: The shift to proof-of-stake has analysts exploring its impact on the blockchain’s much-touted decentralization.

entry.title: Ethereum Fork ETHPoW Gets Off to Rocky Start
entry.summary: Technical issues stymied the launch of the forked, post-merge proof-of-work blockchain.

entry.title: Gensler Says Proof-of-Stake Assets Could Be Securities: Report
entry.summary: According to a Thursday WSJ report, SEC Chairman Gary Gensler said proof-of-stake cryptocurrencies could qualify as securities under the Howey Test.

entry.title: Treasury Sanctions Pro-Russia Groups Raising Funds With Crypto
entry.summary: The list of blacklisted addresses includes those said to belong to a Russian Neo-Nazi group.

entry.title: A Bored Ape Ethereum NFT Owner is Launching a Real-World Yacht Club
entry.summary: Not enough yachts in the Bored Ape Yacht Club? One NFT holder, crypto CEO, and yacht owner plans to change all of that.

entry.title: Bitcoin Is a ‘Tumor,’ Says ‘Black Swan’ Author Nassim Taleb
entry.summary: Taleb suggests Bitcoin could go to $1,000—or to zero—if markets worsened.

entry.title: Senator Toomey Challenges Gensler’s View That Nearly 'All Crypto Tokens Are Securities'
entry.summary: Toomey also said he believes the SEC has not been clear about the framework it uses to judge which cryptocurrencies qualify as securities.

entry.title: Ethereum Energy Usage, Carbon Footprint Down 99.99% After Merge: Report
entry.summary: The merge has slashed Ethereum’s energy needs even more than expected, according to a report from the Crypto Carbon Ratings Institute.

entry.title: Ethereum Price Crashes Under $1,500 After Successful Merge
entry.summary: The merge hype has faded as the price of ETH sharply drops this morning.

entry.title: Fortnite Creator's Epic Games Store Launches First NFT Game
entry.summary: Mythical Games’ Blankos Block Party, which the studio claims has more than a million players, is now available on the Epic Games marketplace.

entry.title: What Is 'The Merge'? Ethereum’s Move to Proof of Stake
entry.summary: In September 2022, the Ethereum mainnet merged with the Beacon Chain, completing the blockchain's transition from proof of work to proof of stake.

entry.title: Bankrupt Celsius Under More Scrutiny as Court Appoints Independent Examiner
entry.summary: An independent examiner will now lead Celsius’ bankruptcy case, following allegations of “gross mismanagement” by the United States Trustee.

entry.title: Tron’s Grand Hackathon Season 3 Launches With $1.2M Prize Pool
entry.summary: The third season of Tron’s hackathon kicks off, with six tracks for developers to pursue—including new Ecosystem and Academy tracks.

entry.title: Coinbase Now Lets Users Check Which Politicians Are Crypto-Friendly
entry.summary: With midterm elections just around the corner, Coinbase is rolling out an in-app tool to help users see which candidate is pro-crypto.

entry.title: Decrypt-O's Ep. 2: Who Cares About the Ethereum Merge?
entry.summary: The Ethereum merge will happen this week. In this serving of Decrypt-O's, Kate Irwin explains the Bellatrix upgrade and the shadow fork, Dan Roberts predicts the impact Ethereum's move to proof of stake will have on Bitcoin's energy use PR problem (plus commentary from Dan Held from the gm podcast), and Sander Lutz hits the street in Hollyweird to ask regular folks if they know and care about the merge. (Production by Zack Edelman, editing by Jason Nelson.)

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: The Ethereum Merge
entry.summary: The Ethereum Merge to Proof of Stake (PoS) is one of the most significant technological upgrades in recent history. But why evolve Ethereum at all? Learn the difference between PoW and PoS, why PoS will decrease Ethereum’s carbon footprint by 99.95%, and more in the Infura Web3 Dev Series: The Merge Explained. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: What the Ethereum Merge Means for NFTs
entry.summary: The years-anticipated Ethereum Merge is less than a week away. Everyone is buzzing about what it will mean for the crypto market and for proof of work vs proof of stake, but what will the effect be on NFTs? Dan Roberts, Andrew Hayward, Kate Irwin and Sander Lutz break it down in our latest live roundtable.

entry.title: Decrypt-O's Ep. 1: Tornado Cash Privacy Fears, Bored Ape VMAs Hate, Sheriff Gensler
entry.summary: Eat your Decrypt-O’s! In the debut episode, Sander Lutz hits the street to ask people about their privacy concerns in the wake of the government’s Tornado Cash crackdown; Kate Irwin shares headlines on the wackiest Web3 stories, from Crypto.com sending a woman $10 million by accident to Eminem and Snoop Dogg getting Twitter hate for their Bored Apes; and Dan Roberts serves up a rant about Gary Gensler. (Production and editing by Zack Edelman.)

entry.title: gm: Bitcoiner Dan Held Talks Ethereum Merge, PoW vs PoS, and NFTs
entry.summary: Dan Held is an old-school Bitcoiner who has been in the space since the very beginning; he sold his price app ZeroBlock to Blockchain.info in 2013. But while he's largely seen as a Bitcoin maximalist by his half a million fans on Twitter, he tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott he's a "permissive" and "open-minded" Bitcoiner: he's watching the Ethereum Merge closely, and he admits Ethereum's move to proof of stake will put pressure on Bitcoin's energy use. Watch Episode 18 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Ethereum Merge Is on the Horizon
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, Jason Nelson, and Sander Lutz break down all the angles, from the timing to the expected market reaction to the technical elements.

entry.title: VCs and Family Offices Go Crypto: Hashed, Lux, Cleo, RW3 and Protofund at Crypto Bahamas
entry.summary: Baek Kim of Hashed, Grace Isford of Lux Capital, Sarah Kunst of Cleo Capital, Peter Najarian of RW3 Ventures, and Edward Moncada of Protofund talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts onstage at FTX's Crypto Bahamas event about VCs and family offices allocating money into crypto and the outlook for institutional DeFi.

entry.title: From Silk Road to Buying ETH: How Musician Tycho Went Crypto
entry.summary: Scott Hansen aka Tycho, the musician, producer, and songwriter, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin how he caught the crypto bug and why he believes Web3 can change the music industry for the better.

entry.title: gm: Decentralized Pictures CEO on How Web3 Can Change Hollywood
entry.summary: Decentralized Pictures, the nonprofit co-founded by Roman Coppola, is enabling on-chain voting to greenlight and fund film projects. CEO Leo Matchett tells Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves how the anti-crypto stigma in Hollywood is fading, how Web3 can bring more diversity to the film world and disrupt the traditional gatekeepers, and how he first got into crypto when he and Coppola set up a Bitcoin miner in an empty sound stage.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is a Node?
entry.summary: In this video, we’ll learn about a core component that defines Web3: blockchain nodes. A node is one of the many computers that power a decentralized network like Ethereum. Learn about the different types of nodes and why they’re part of the core infrastructure that make Web3 possible. Visit Infura.io today to start building. Written by: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.
